titleStmt.title: The oppressed prisoners complaint of their great oppression: with a loud call to Englands magistrates for the exercise of impartial justice, before the wrath of the lamb break forth. With a brief relation of the unparallel'd proceedings of the court, at the Old Baily, the fifth day of the fifth month, 1662.
titleStmt.author: Blackborow, Sarah.

titleStmt.title: The oppressed prisoners complaint of their great oppression: with a loud call to Englands magistrates for the exercise of impartial justice, before the wrath of the lamb break forth. With a brief relation of the unparallel'd proceedings of the court, at the Old Baily, the fifth day of the fifth month, 1662.
titleStmt.author: Blackborow, Sarah.

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: Written by S.B. a prisoner, i.e. Sarah Blackborow--Wing.
Verse - "Repent, O England, for what thou hast done".
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C..
